com.whirvis.jraknet.server

Interface RakNetServerListener

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RakNetServer

    public interface RakNetServerListener
    Used to listen for events that occur in the RakNetServer. In order to listen for events, one must use the RakNetServer.addListener(RakNetServerListener) method.
    Since:
    JRakNet v1.0.0
    Author:
    Trent "Whirvis" Summerlin

      • onConnect

        default void onConnect(RakNetServer server,
                       java.net.InetSocketAddress address,
                       ConnectionType connectionType)
        Called when a client has connected to the server.

        This is not the same as onLogin(RakNetServer, RakNetClientPeer), where the client has also completed connection and login.

        Parameters:
        server - the server.
        address - the address of the client.
        connectionType - the connection type of the client.

      • onLogin

        default void onLogin(RakNetServer server,
                     RakNetClientPeer peer)
        Called when a client has logged in to the server.

        This is not the same as onConnect(RakNetServer, InetSocketAddress, ConnectionType), where the client has only connected to the server and has not yet logged in.

        Parameters:
        server - the server.
        peer - the client that logged in.

      • onDisconnect

        default void onDisconnect(RakNetServer server,
                          java.net.InetSocketAddress address,
                          RakNetClientPeer peer,
                          java.lang.String reason)
        Called when a client has disconnected from the server.
        Parameters:
        server - the server.
        address - the address of the client that disconnected.
        peer - the client that disconnected, this will be null if the client has not yet logged in.
        reason - the reason the client disconnected.

      • onBan

        default void onBan(RakNetServer server,
                   java.net.InetAddress address,
                   java.lang.String reason)
        Called when a client is banned from the server.

        When a client is banned from the server, they will be actively disconnected with a CONNECTION_BANNED packet. This is different from having an address blocked, as all packets sent from the address will simply be ignored. The server will never automatically ban a client. However, it will automatically block an address if it is suspected of a DOS attack.

        Parameters:
        server - the server.
        address - the address of the client.
        reason - the reason the client was banned.

      • onUnban

        default void onUnban(RakNetServer server,
                     java.net.InetAddress address)
        Called when a client is unbanned from the server.
        Parameters:
        server - the server.
        address - the address of the client.

      • onBlock

        default void onBlock(RakNetServer server,
                     java.net.InetAddress address,
                     java.lang.String reason,
                     long time)
        Called when an address is blocked by the server.

        When an address is blocked, all packets sent from it will simply be ignored. This is different from a client being banned, as it will actively be disconnected with a CONNECTION_BANNED packet. The server will never automatically ban a client. However, it will automatically block an address if it is suspected of a DOS attack.

        Parameters:
        server - the server.
        address - the address that was blocked.
        reason - the reason the address was blocked.
        time - how long the address is blocked, with meaning the address is permanently blocked.

      • onUnblock

        default void onUnblock(RakNetServer server,
                       java.net.InetAddress address)
        Called when an address has been unblocked by the server.
        Parameters:
        server - the server.
        address - the address that has been unblocked.

      • onAcknowledge

        default void onAcknowledge(RakNetServer server,
                           RakNetClientPeer peer,
                           Record record,
                           EncapsulatedPacket packet)
        Called when a message is acknowledged by a client.
        Parameters:
        server - the server.
        peer - the client that acknwoledged the packet.
        record - the acknowledged record.
        packet - the acknowledged packet.

      • onLoss

        default void onLoss(RakNetServer server,
                    RakNetClientPeer peer,
                    Record record,
                    EncapsulatedPacket packet)
        Called when a message is lost by a client.
        Parameters:
        server - the server.
        peer - the client that lost the packet.
        record - the lost record.
        packet - the lost packet.

      • handleMessage

        default void handleMessage(RakNetServer server,
                           RakNetClientPeer peer,
                           RakNetPacket packet,
                           int channel)
        Called when a packet has been received from a client and is ready to be handled.
        Parameters:
        server - the server.
        peer - the client that sent the packet.
        packet - the packet received from the client.
        channel - the channel the packet was sent on.

      • handleUnknownMessage

        default void handleUnknownMessage(RakNetServer server,
                                  RakNetClientPeer peer,
                                  RakNetPacket packet,
                                  int channel)
        Called when a packet with an ID below ID_USER_PACKET_ENUM cannot be handled by the RakNetClientPeer because it is not programmed to handle it.

        This function can be used to add missing features from the regular RakNet protocol that are absent in JRakNet if needed.

        Parameters:
        server - the server.
        peer - the client that sent the packet.
        packet - the unknown packet.
        channel - the channel the packet was sent on.

      • handleNettyMessage

        default void handleNettyMessage(RakNetServer server,
                                java.net.InetSocketAddress address,
                                io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buf)
        Called when the handler receives a packet after the server has already handled it.

        This method is useful for handling packets outside of the RakNet protocol. All packets received here have already been handled by the server.

        Parameters:
        server - the server.
        address - the address of the sender.
        buf - the buffer of the received packet.

      • onHandlerException

        default void onHandlerException(RakNetServer server,
                                java.net.InetSocketAddress address,
                                java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Called when a handler exception has occurred.

        These normally do not matter as long as the server handles them on its own.

        Parameters:
        server - the server.
        address - the address that caused the exception.
        throwable - the Throwable that was caught.

      • onPeerException

        default void onPeerException(RakNetServer server,
                             RakNetClientPeer peer,
                             java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Called when an exception thrown by a peer has been caught.
        Parameters:
        server - the server.
        peer - the peer that caused the exception.
        throwable - the Throwable that was caught.
